column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////With the air of a 60s luncheonette
column2: and stylish with stone and natural light
column3: Common Bond makes me feel like indulging upon entering. Then
column4: I enter a hurried line which takes me to the five different treats
column5: displayed like jewelry in a case. While there are only five different kinds
column6: there are many of them. I order three: earl grey tea cream puff
column8: and a dish of lemon cream. I order a cold latte and the BF ordered a cappuccino. Once we sat down
column9: I felt a little less overwhelmed about the crowd. Our coffee drinks were smooth and rich and our barista was helpful and attentive.
